page.title: 15ULLAPOOL-STORNOWAY FERRY.
page.content: Caledonian MacBrayne began a ferry service from Ullapool to Stornoway in April 1973. The current vessel,the Suilven,weighs approximately 2000t.,is 200 ft. long and has a crew of 25 to 30 persons. The number of passengers using the ferry yearly, averages 90000, with a summer average of 5000 per week and a winter average of 950 per week. The maximum number of passengers carried by the Suilven is 416. The maximum number of vehicles per journey: Cars-60,Commercial-17. The ferry sails twice a day from May to September and once a day at other times. The Suilven goes for an annual refit in November and another vessel replaces her during this period. Cancellations due to bad weather average three to four per year.
